00073 static struct ptlrpc_sec_policy gss_policy_pipefs;
00074 static struct ptlrpc_ctx_ops gss_pipefs_ctxops;
00075 
00076 static int gss_cli_ctx_refresh_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx);
00077 
00078 static int gss_sec_pipe_upcall_init(struct gss_sec *gsec)
00079 {
00080         return 0;
00081 }
00082 
00083 static void gss_sec_pipe_upcall_fini(struct gss_sec *gsec)
00084 {
00085 }

00087 /****************************************
00088  * internal context helpers             *
00089  ****************************************/
00090 
00091 static
00092 struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx_create_pf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00093                                      struct vfs_cred *vcred)
00094 {
00095         struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx;
00096         int                 rc;
00097 
00098         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(gctx);
00099         if (gctx == NULL)
00100                 return NULL;
00101 
00102         rc = gss_cli_ctx_init_common(sec, &gctx->gc_base,
00103                                      &gss_pipefs_ctxops, vcred);
00104         if (rc) {
00105                 OBD_FREE_PTR(gctx);
00106                 return NULL;
00107         }
00108 
00109         return &gctx->gc_base;
00110 }
00111 
00112 static
00113 void ctx_destroy_pf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec, struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00114 {
00115         struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx = ctx2gctx(ctx);
00116 
00117         if (gss_cli_ctx_fini_common(sec, ctx))
00118                 return;
00119 
00120         OBD_FREE_PTR(gctx);
00121 
00122         atomic_dec(&sec->ps_nctx);
00123         sptlrpc_sec_put(sec);
00124 }
00125 
00126 static
00127 void ctx_enhash_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct hlist_head *hash)
00128 {
00129         set_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00130         atomic_inc(&ctx->cc_refcount);
00131         hlist_add_head(&ctx->cc_cache, hash);
00132 }
00133 
00134 /*
00135  * caller must hold spinlock
00136  */
00137 static
00138 void ctx_unhash_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct hlist_head *freelist)
00139 {
00140         assert_spin_locked(&ctx->cc_sec->ps_lock);
00141         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) > 0);
00142         LASSERT(test_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags));
00143         LASSERT(!hlist_unhashed(&ctx->cc_cache));
00144 
00145         clear_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00146 
00147         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&ctx->cc_refcount)) {
00148                 __hlist_del(&ctx->cc_cache);
00149                 hlist_add_head(&ctx->cc_cache, freelist);
00150         } else {
00151                 hlist_del_init(&ctx->cc_cache);
00152         }
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*
00156  * return 1 if the context is dead.
00157  */
00158 static
00159 int ctx_check_death_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00160                        struct hlist_head *freelist)
00161 {
00162         if (cli_ctx_check_death(ctx)) {
00163                 if (freelist)
00164                         ctx_unhash_pf(ctx, freelist);
00165                 return 1;
00166         }
00167 
00168         return 0;
00169 }
00170 
00171 static inline
00172 int ctx_check_death_locked_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00173                               struct hlist_head *freelist)
00174 {
00175         LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec);
00176         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) > 0);
00177         LASSERT(test_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags));
00178 
00179         return ctx_check_death_pf(ctx, freelist);
00180 }
00181 
00182 static inline
00183 int ctx_match_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct vfs_cred *vcred)
00184 {
00185         /* a little bit optimization for null policy */
00186         if (!ctx->cc_ops->match)
00187                 return 1;
00188 
00189         return ctx->cc_ops->match(ctx, vcred);
00190 }
00191 
00192 static
00193 void ctx_list_destroy_pf(struct hlist_head *head)
00194 {
00195         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx;
00196 
00197         while (!hlist_empty(head)) {
00198                 ctx = cfs_hlist_entry(head->first, struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx,
00199                                       cc_cache);
00200 
00201                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) == 0);
00202                 LASSERT(test_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED_BIT,
00203                                  &ctx->cc_flags) == 0);
00204 
00205                 hlist_del_init(&ctx->cc_cache);
00206                 ctx_destroy_pf(ctx->cc_sec, ctx);
00207         }
00208 }
00209 
00210 /****************************************
00211  * context apis                         *
00212  ****************************************/
00213 
00214 static
00215 int gss_cli_ctx_validate_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00216 {
00217         if (ctx_check_death_pf(ctx, NULL))
00218                 return 1;
00219         if (cli_ctx_is_ready(ctx))
00220                 return 0;
00221         return 1;
00222 }
00223 
00224 static
00225 void gss_cli_ctx_die_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, int grace)
00226 {
00227         LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec);
00228         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) > 0);
00229 
00230         cli_ctx_expire(ctx);
00231 
00232         spin_lock(&ctx->cc_sec->ps_lock);
00233 
00234         if (test_and_clear_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags)) {
00235                 LASSERT(!hlist_unhashed(&ctx->cc_cache));
00236                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) > 1);
00237 
00238                 hlist_del_init(&ctx->cc_cache);
00239                 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&ctx->cc_refcount))
00240                         LBUG();
00241         }
00242 
00243         spin_unlock(&ctx->cc_sec->ps_lock);
00244 }
00245 
00246 /****************************************
00247  * reverse context installation         *
00248  ****************************************/
00249 
00250 static inline
00251 unsigned int ctx_hash_index(int hashsize, __u64 key)
00252 {
00253         return (unsigned int) (key & ((__u64) hashsize - 1));
00254 }
00255 
00256 static
00257 void gss_sec_ctx_replace_pf(struct gss_sec *gsec,
00258                             struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *new)
00259 {
00260         struct hlist_node __maybe_unused *pos, *next;
00261         struct gss_sec_pipefs *gsec_pf;
00262         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx;
00263         HLIST_HEAD(freelist);
00264         unsigned int hash;
00265         ENTRY;
00266 
00267         gsec_pf = container_of(gsec, struct gss_sec_pipefs, gsp_base);
00268 
00269         hash = ctx_hash_index(gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size,
00270                               (__u64) new->cc_vcred.vc_uid);
00271         LASSERT(hash < gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size);
00272 
00273         spin_lock(&gsec->gs_base.ps_lock);
00274 
00275         cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_safe(ctx, pos, next,
00276                                       &gsec_pf->gsp_chash[hash], cc_cache) {
00277                 if (!ctx_match_pf(ctx, &new->cc_vcred))
00278                         continue;
00279 
00280                 cli_ctx_expire(ctx);
00281                 ctx_unhash_pf(ctx, &freelist);
00282                 break;
00283         }
00284 
00285         ctx_enhash_pf(new, &gsec_pf->gsp_chash[hash]);
00286 
00287         spin_unlock(&gsec->gs_base.ps_lock);
00288 
00289         ctx_list_destroy_pf(&freelist);
00290         EXIT;
00291 }
00292 
00293 static
00294 int gss_install_rvs_cli_ctx_pf(struct gss_sec *gsec,
00295                                struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *svc_ctx)
00296 {
00297         struct vfs_cred          vcred;
00298         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx   *cli_ctx;
00299         int                      rc;
00300         ENTRY;
00301 
00302         vcred.vc_uid = 0;
00303         vcred.vc_gid = 0;
00304 
00305         cli_ctx = ctx_create_pf(&gsec->gs_base, &vcred);
00306         if (!cli_ctx)
00307                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00308 
00309         rc = gss_copy_rvc_cli_ctx(cli_ctx, svc_ctx);
00310         if (rc) {
00311                 ctx_destroy_pf(cli_ctx->cc_sec, cli_ctx);
00312                 RETURN(rc);
00313         }
00314 
00315         gss_sec_ctx_replace_pf(gsec, cli_ctx);
00316         RETURN(0);
00317 }
00318 
00319 static
00320 void gss_ctx_cache_gc_pf(struct gss_sec_pipefs *gsec_pf,
00321                          struct hlist_head *freelist)
00322 {
00323         struct ptlrpc_sec       *sec;
00324         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx   *ctx;
00325         struct hlist_node       __maybe_unused *pos;
00326         struct hlist_node       *next;
00327         int i;
00328         ENTRY;
00329 
00330         sec = &gsec_pf->gsp_base.gs_base;
00331 
00332         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "do gc on sec %s@%p\n", sec->ps_policy->sp_name, sec);
00333 
00334         for (i = 0; i < gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size; i++) {
00335                 cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_safe(ctx, pos, next,
00336                                               &gsec_pf->gsp_chash[i], cc_cache)
00337                         ctx_check_death_locked_pf(ctx, freelist);
00338         }
00339 
00340         sec->ps_gc_next = cfs_time_current_sec() + sec->ps_gc_interval;
00341         EXIT;
00342 }
00343 
00344 static
00345 struct ptlrpc_sec* gss_sec_create_pf(struct obd_import *imp,
00346                                      struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *ctx,
00347                                      struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
00348 {
00349         struct gss_sec_pipefs   *gsec_pf;
00350         int                      alloc_size, hash_size, i;
00351         ENTRY;
00352 
00353 #define GSS_SEC_PIPEFS_CTX_HASH_SIZE    (32)
00354 
00355         if (ctx ||
00356             sf->sf_flags & (PTLRPC_SEC_FL_ROOTONLY | PTLRPC_SEC_FL_REVERSE))
00357                 hash_size = 1;
00358         else
00359                 hash_size = GSS_SEC_PIPEFS_CTX_HASH_SIZE;
00360 
00361         alloc_size = sizeof(*gsec_pf) +
00362                      sizeof(struct hlist_head) * hash_size;
00363 
00364         OBD_ALLOC(gsec_pf, alloc_size);
00365         if (!gsec_pf)
00366                 RETURN(NULL);
00367 
00368         gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size = hash_size;
00369         for (i = 0; i < hash_size; i++)
00370                 INIT_HLIST_HEAD(&gsec_pf->gsp_chash[i]);
00371 
00372         if (gss_sec_create_common(&gsec_pf->gsp_base, &gss_policy_pipefs,
00373                                   imp, ctx, sf))
00374                 goto err_free;
00375 
00376         if (ctx == NULL) {
00377                 if (gss_sec_pipe_upcall_init(&gsec_pf->gsp_base))
00378                         goto err_destroy;
00379         } else {
00380                 if (gss_install_rvs_cli_ctx_pf(&gsec_pf->gsp_base, ctx))
00381                         goto err_destroy;
00382         }
00383 
00384         RETURN(&gsec_pf->gsp_base.gs_base);
00385 
00386 err_destroy:
00387         gss_sec_destroy_common(&gsec_pf->gsp_base);
00388 err_free:
00389         OBD_FREE(gsec_pf, alloc_size);
00390         RETURN(NULL);
00391 }
00392 
00393 static
00394 void gss_sec_destroy_pf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00395 {
00396         struct gss_sec_pipefs   *gsec_pf;
00397         struct gss_sec          *gsec;
00398 
00399         CWARN("destroy %s@%p\n", sec->ps_policy->sp_name, sec);
00400 
00401         gsec = container_of(sec, struct gss_sec, gs_base);
00402         gsec_pf = container_of(gsec, struct gss_sec_pipefs, gsp_base);
00403 
00404         LASSERT(gsec_pf->gsp_chash);
00405         LASSERT(gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size);
00406 
00407         gss_sec_pipe_upcall_fini(gsec);
00408 
00409         gss_sec_destroy_common(gsec);
00410 
00411         OBD_FREE(gsec, sizeof(*gsec_pf) +
00412                        sizeof(struct hlist_head) * gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size);
00413 }
00414 
00415 static
00416 struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx * gss_sec_lookup_ctx_pf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00417                                               struct vfs_cred *vcred,
00418                                               int create, int remove_dead)
00419 {
00420         struct gss_sec          *gsec;
00421         struct gss_sec_pipefs   *gsec_pf;
00422         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx   *ctx = NULL, *new = NULL;
00423         struct hlist_head       *hash_head;
00424         struct hlist_node       __maybe_unused *pos, *next;
00425         unsigned int            hash, gc = 0, found = 0;
00426         HLIST_HEAD(freelist);
00427         ENTRY;
00428 
00429         might_sleep();
00430 
00431         gsec = container_of(sec, struct gss_sec, gs_base);
00432         gsec_pf = container_of(gsec, struct gss_sec_pipefs, gsp_base);
00433 
00434         hash = ctx_hash_index(gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size,
00435                               (__u64) vcred->vc_uid);
00436         hash_head = &gsec_pf->gsp_chash[hash];
00437         LASSERT(hash < gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size);
00438 
00439 retry:
00440         spin_lock(&sec->ps_lock);
00441 
00442         /* gc_next == 0 means never do gc */
00443         if (remove_dead && sec->ps_gc_next &&
00444             cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current_sec(), sec->ps_gc_next)) {
00445                 gss_ctx_cache_gc_pf(gsec_pf, &freelist);
00446                 gc = 1;
00447         }
00448 
00449         cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_safe(ctx, pos, next, hash_head, cc_cache) {
00450                 if (gc == 0 &&
00451                     ctx_check_death_locked_pf(ctx,
00452                                               remove_dead ? &freelist : NULL))
00453                         continue;
00454 
00455                 if (ctx_match_pf(ctx, vcred)) {
00456                         found = 1;
00457                         break;
00458                 }
00459         }
00460 
00461         if (found) {
00462                 if (new && new != ctx) {
00463                         /* lost the race, just free it */
00464                         hlist_add_head(&new->cc_cache, &freelist);
00465                         new = NULL;
00466                 }
00467 
00468                 /* hot node, move to head */
00469                 if (hash_head->first != &ctx->cc_cache) {
00470                         __hlist_del(&ctx->cc_cache);
00471                         hlist_add_head(&ctx->cc_cache, hash_head);
00472                 }
00473         } else {
00474                 /* don't allocate for reverse sec */
00475                 if (sec_is_reverse(sec)) {
00476                         spin_unlock(&sec->ps_lock);
00477                         RETURN(NULL);
00478                 }
00479 
00480                 if (new) {
00481                         ctx_enhash_pf(new, hash_head);
00482                         ctx = new;
00483                 } else if (create) {
00484                         spin_unlock(&sec->ps_lock);
00485                         new = ctx_create_pf(sec, vcred);
00486                         if (new) {
00487                                 clear_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_NEW_BIT, &new->cc_flags);
00488                                 goto retry;
00489                         }
00490                 } else {
00491                         ctx = NULL;
00492                 }
00493         }
00494 
00495         /* hold a ref */
00496         if (ctx)
00497                 atomic_inc(&ctx->cc_refcount);
00498 
00499         spin_unlock(&sec->ps_lock);
00500 
00501         /* the allocator of the context must give the first push to refresh */
00502         if (new) {
00503                 LASSERT(new == ctx);
00504                 gss_cli_ctx_refresh_pf(new);
00505         }
00506 
00507         ctx_list_destroy_pf(&freelist);
00508         RETURN(ctx);
00509 }
00510 
00511 static
00512 void gss_sec_release_ctx_pf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00513                             struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00514                             int sync)
00515 {
00516         LASSERT(test_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags) == 0);
00517         LASSERT(hlist_unhashed(&ctx->cc_cache));
00518 
00519         /* if required async, we must clear the UPTODATE bit to prevent extra
00520          * rpcs during destroy procedure. */
00521         if (!sync)
00522                 clear_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00523 
00524         /* destroy this context */
00525         ctx_destroy_pf(sec, ctx);
00526 }
00527 
00528 /*
00529  * @uid: which user. "-1" means flush all.
00530  * @grace: mark context DEAD, allow graceful destroy like notify
00531  *         server side, etc.
00532  * @force: also flush busy entries.
00533  *
00534  * return the number of busy context encountered.
00535  *
00536  * In any cases, never touch "eternal" contexts.
00537  */
00538 static
00539 int gss_sec_flush_ctx_cache_pf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00540                                uid_t uid,
00541                                int grace, int force)
00542 {
00543         struct gss_sec          *gsec;
00544         struct gss_sec_pipefs   *gsec_pf;
00545         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx   *ctx;
00546         struct hlist_node       __maybe_unused *pos, *next;
00547         HLIST_HEAD(freelist);
00548         int i, busy = 0;
00549         ENTRY;
00550 
00551         might_sleep_if(grace);
00552 
00553         gsec = container_of(sec, struct gss_sec, gs_base);
00554         gsec_pf = container_of(gsec, struct gss_sec_pipefs, gsp_base);
00555 
00556         spin_lock(&sec->ps_lock);
00557         for (i = 0; i < gsec_pf->gsp_chash_size; i++) {
00558                 cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_safe(ctx, pos, next,
00559                                               &gsec_pf->gsp_chash[i],
00560                                               cc_cache) {
00561                         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) > 0);
00562 
00563                         if (uid != -1 && uid != ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid)
00564                                 continue;
00565 
00566                         if (atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) > 1) {
00567                                 busy++;
00568                                 if (!force)
00569                                         continue;
00570 
00571                                 CWARN("flush busy(%d) ctx %p(%u->%s) by force, "
00572                                       "grace %d\n",
00573                                       atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount),
00574                                       ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid,
00575                                       sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec), grace);
00576                         }
00577                         ctx_unhash_pf(ctx, &freelist);
00578 
00579                         set_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_DEAD_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00580                         if (!grace)
00581                                 clear_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE_BIT,
00582                                           &ctx->cc_flags);
00583                 }
00584         }
00585         spin_unlock(&sec->ps_lock);
00586 
00587         ctx_list_destroy_pf(&freelist);
00588         RETURN(busy);
00589 }
00590 
00591 /****************************************
00592  * service apis                         *
00593  ****************************************/
00594 
00595 static
00596 int gss_svc_accept_pf(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00597 {
00598         return gss_svc_accept(&gss_policy_pipefs, req);
00599 }
00600 
00601 static
00602 int gss_svc_install_rctx_pf(struct obd_import *imp,
00603                             struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *ctx)
00604 {
00605         struct ptlrpc_sec *sec;
00606         int                rc;
00607 
00608         sec = sptlrpc_import_sec_ref(imp);
00609         LASSERT(sec);
00610         rc = gss_install_rvs_cli_ctx_pf(sec2gsec(sec), ctx);
00611 
00612         sptlrpc_sec_put(sec);
00613         return rc;
00614 }
00615 
00616 /****************************************
00617  * rpc_pipefs definitions               *
00618  ****************************************/
00619 
00620 #define LUSTRE_PIPE_ROOT        "/lustre"
00621 #define LUSTRE_PIPE_KRB5        LUSTRE_PIPE_ROOT"/krb5"
00622 
00623 struct gss_upcall_msg_data {
00624         __u32                           gum_seq;
00625         __u32                           gum_uid;
00626         __u32                           gum_gid;
00627         __u32                           gum_svc;        /* MDS/OSS... */
00628         __u64                           gum_nid;        /* peer NID */
00629         __u8                            gum_obd[64];    /* client obd name */
00630 };
00631 
00632 struct gss_upcall_msg {
00633         struct rpc_pipe_msg             gum_base;
00634         atomic_t                        gum_refcount;
00635         struct list_head                gum_list;
00636         __u32                           gum_mechidx;
00637         struct gss_sec                  *gum_gsec;
00638         struct gss_cli_ctx              *gum_gctx;
00639         struct gss_upcall_msg_data      gum_data;
00640 };
00641 
00642 static atomic_t upcall_seq = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
00643 
00644 static inline
00645 __u32 upcall_get_sequence(void)
00646 {
00647         return (__u32) atomic_inc_return(&upcall_seq);
00648 }
00649 
00650 enum mech_idx_t {
00651         MECH_KRB5   = 0,
00652         MECH_MAX
00653 };
00654 
00655 static inline
00656 __u32 mech_name2idx(const char *name)
00657 {
00658         LASSERT(!strcmp(name, "krb5"));
00659         return MECH_KRB5;
00660 }
00661 
00662 /* pipefs dentries for each mechanisms */
00663 static struct dentry *de_pipes[MECH_MAX] = { NULL, };
00664 /* all upcall messgaes linked here */
00665 static struct list_head upcall_lists[MECH_MAX];
00666 /* and protected by this */
00667 static spinlock_t upcall_locks[MECH_MAX];
00668 
00669 static inline
00670 void upcall_list_lock(int idx)
00671 {
00672         spin_lock(&upcall_locks[idx]);
00673 }
00674 
00675 static inline
00676 void upcall_list_unlock(int idx)
00677 {
00678         spin_unlock(&upcall_locks[idx]);
00679 }
00680 
00681 static
00682 void upcall_msg_enlist(struct gss_upcall_msg *msg)
00683 {
00684         __u32 idx = msg->gum_mechidx;
00685 
00686         upcall_list_lock(idx);
00687         list_add(&msg->gum_list, &upcall_lists[idx]);
00688         upcall_list_unlock(idx);
00689 }
00690 
00691 static
00692 void upcall_msg_delist(struct gss_upcall_msg *msg)
00693 {
00694         __u32 idx = msg->gum_mechidx;
00695 
00696         upcall_list_lock(idx);
00697         list_del_init(&msg->gum_list);
00698         upcall_list_unlock(idx);
00699 }
00700 
00701 /****************************************
00702  * rpc_pipefs upcall helpers            *
00703  ****************************************/
00704 
00705 static
00706 void gss_release_msg(struct gss_upcall_msg *gmsg)
00707 {
00708         ENTRY;
00709         LASSERT(atomic_read(&gmsg->gum_refcount) > 0);
00710 
00711         if (!atomic_dec_and_test(&gmsg->gum_refcount)) {
00712                 EXIT;
00713                 return;
00714         }
00715 
00716         if (gmsg->gum_gctx) {
00717                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_wakeup(&gmsg->gum_gctx->gc_base);
00718                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_put(&gmsg->gum_gctx->gc_base, 1);
00719                 gmsg->gum_gctx = NULL;
00720         }
00721 
00722         LASSERT(list_empty(&gmsg->gum_list));
00723         LASSERT(list_empty(&gmsg->gum_base.list));
00724         OBD_FREE_PTR(gmsg);
00725         EXIT;
00726 }
00727 
00728 static
00729 void gss_unhash_msg_nolock(struct gss_upcall_msg *gmsg)
00730 {
00731         __u32 idx = gmsg->gum_mechidx;
00732 
00733         LASSERT(idx < MECH_MAX);
00734         assert_spin_locked(&upcall_locks[idx]);
00735 
00736         if (list_empty(&gmsg->gum_list))
00737                 return;
00738 
00739         list_del_init(&gmsg->gum_list);
00740         LASSERT(atomic_read(&gmsg->gum_refcount) > 1);
00741         atomic_dec(&gmsg->gum_refcount);
00742 }
00743 
00744 static
00745 void gss_unhash_msg(struct gss_upcall_msg *gmsg)
00746 {
00747         __u32 idx = gmsg->gum_mechidx;
00748 
00749         LASSERT(idx < MECH_MAX);
00750         upcall_list_lock(idx);
00751         gss_unhash_msg_nolock(gmsg);
00752         upcall_list_unlock(idx);
00753 }
00754 
00755 static
00756 void gss_msg_fail_ctx(struct gss_upcall_msg *gmsg)
00757 {
00758         if (gmsg->gum_gctx) {
00759                 struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx = &gmsg->gum_gctx->gc_base;
00760 
00761                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) > 0);
00762                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_expire(ctx);
00763                 set_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_ERROR_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00764         }
00765 }
00766 
00767 static
00768 struct gss_upcall_msg * gss_find_upcall(__u32 mechidx, __u32 seq)
00769 {
00770         struct gss_upcall_msg *gmsg;
00771 
00772         upcall_list_lock(mechidx);
00773         list_for_each_entry(gmsg, &upcall_lists[mechidx], gum_list) {
00774                 if (gmsg->gum_data.gum_seq != seq)
00775                         continue;
00776 
00777                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&gmsg->gum_refcount) > 0);
00778                 LASSERT(gmsg->gum_mechidx == mechidx);
00779 
00780                 atomic_inc(&gmsg->gum_refcount);
00781                 upcall_list_unlock(mechidx);
00782                 return gmsg;
00783         }
00784         upcall_list_unlock(mechidx);
00785         return NULL;
00786 }
00787 
00788 static
00789 int simple_get_bytes(char **buf, __u32 *buflen, void *res, __u32 reslen)
00790 {
00791         if (*buflen < reslen) {
00792                 CERROR("buflen %u < %u\n", *buflen, reslen);
00793                 return -EINVAL;
00794         }
00795 
00796         memcpy(res, *buf, reslen);
00797         *buf += reslen;
00798         *buflen -= reslen;
00799         return 0;
00800 }
00801 
00802 /****************************************
00803  * rpc_pipefs apis                      *
00804  ****************************************/
00805 
00806 static
00807 ssize_t gss_pipe_upcall(struct file *filp, struct rpc_pipe_msg *msg,
00808                         char *dst, size_t buflen)
00809 {
00810         char *data = (char *)msg->data + msg->copied;
00811         ssize_t mlen = msg->len;
00812         ssize_t left;
00813         ENTRY;
00814 
00815         if (mlen > buflen)
00816                 mlen = buflen;
00817         left = copy_to_user(dst, data, mlen);
00818         if (left < 0) {
00819                 msg->errno = left;
00820                 RETURN(left);
00821         }
00822         mlen -= left;
00823         msg->copied += mlen;
00824         msg->errno = 0;
00825         RETURN(mlen);
00826 }
00827 
00828 static
00829 ssize_t gss_pipe_downcall(struct file *filp, const char *src, size_t mlen)
00830 {
00831         struct rpc_inode        *rpci = RPC_I(filp->f_path.dentry->d_inode);
00832         struct gss_upcall_msg   *gss_msg;
00833         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx   *ctx;
00834         struct gss_cli_ctx      *gctx = NULL;
00835         char                    *buf, *data;
00836         int                      datalen;
00837         int                      timeout, rc;
00838         __u32                    mechidx, seq, gss_err;
00839         ENTRY;
00840 
00841         mechidx = (__u32) (long) rpci->private;
00842         LASSERT(mechidx < MECH_MAX);
00843 
00844         OBD_ALLOC(buf, mlen);
00845         if (!buf)
00846                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00847 
00848         if (copy_from_user(buf, src, mlen)) {
00849                 CERROR("failed copy user space data\n");
00850                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -EFAULT);
00851         }
00852         data = buf;
00853         datalen = mlen;
00854 
00855         /* data passed down format:
00856          *  - seq
00857          *  - timeout
00858          *  - gc_win / error
00859          *  - wire_ctx (rawobj)
00860          *  - mech_ctx (rawobj)
00861          */
00862         if (simple_get_bytes(&data, &datalen, &seq, sizeof(seq))) {
00863                 CERROR("fail to get seq\n");
00864                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -EFAULT);
00865         }
00866 
00867         gss_msg = gss_find_upcall(mechidx, seq);
00868         if (!gss_msg) {
00869                 CERROR("upcall %u has aborted earlier\n", seq);
00870                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
00871         }
00872 
00873         gss_unhash_msg(gss_msg);
00874         gctx = gss_msg->gum_gctx;
00875         LASSERT(gctx);
00876         LASSERT(atomic_read(&gctx->gc_base.cc_refcount) > 0);
00877 
00878         /* timeout is not in use for now */
00879         if (simple_get_bytes(&data, &datalen, &timeout, sizeof(timeout)))
00880                 GOTO(out_msg, rc = -EFAULT);
00881 
00882         /* lgssd signal an error by gc_win == 0 */
00883         if (simple_get_bytes(&data, &datalen, &gctx->gc_win,
00884                              sizeof(gctx->gc_win)))
00885                 GOTO(out_msg, rc = -EFAULT);
00886 
00887         if (gctx->gc_win == 0) {
00888                 /* followed by:
00889                  * - rpc error
00890                  * - gss error
00891                  */
00892                 if (simple_get_bytes(&data, &datalen, &rc, sizeof(rc)))
00893                         GOTO(out_msg, rc = -EFAULT);
00894                 if (simple_get_bytes(&data, &datalen, &gss_err,sizeof(gss_err)))
00895                         GOTO(out_msg, rc = -EFAULT);
00896 
00897                 if (rc == 0 && gss_err == GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00898                         CWARN("both rpc & gss error code not set\n");
00899                         rc = -EPERM;
00900                 }
00901         } else {
00902                 rawobj_t tmpobj;
00903 
00904                 /* handle */
00905                 if (rawobj_extract_local(&tmpobj, (__u32 **) &data, &datalen))
00906                         GOTO(out_msg, rc = -EFAULT);
00907                 if (rawobj_dup(&gctx->gc_handle, &tmpobj))
00908                         GOTO(out_msg, rc = -ENOMEM);
00909 
00910                 /* mechctx */
00911                 if (rawobj_extract_local(&tmpobj, (__u32 **) &data, &datalen))
00912                         GOTO(out_msg, rc = -EFAULT);
00913                 gss_err = lgss_import_sec_context(&tmpobj,
00914                                                   gss_msg->gum_gsec->gs_mech,
00915                                                   &gctx->gc_mechctx);
00916                 rc = 0;
00917         }
00918 
00919         if (likely(rc == 0 && gss_err == GSS_S_COMPLETE)) {
00920                 gss_cli_ctx_uptodate(gctx);
00921         } else {
00922                 ctx = &gctx->gc_base;
00923                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_expire(ctx);
00924                 if (rc != -ERESTART || gss_err != GSS_S_COMPLETE)
00925                         set_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_ERROR_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00926 
00927                 CERROR("refresh ctx %p(uid %d) failed: %d/0x%08x: %s\n",
00928                        ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, rc, gss_err,
00929                        test_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_ERROR_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags) ?
00930                        "fatal error" : "non-fatal");
00931         }
00932 
00933         rc = mlen;
00934 
00935 out_msg:
00936         gss_release_msg(gss_msg);
00937 
00938 out_free:
00939         OBD_FREE(buf, mlen);
00940         /* FIXME
00941          * hack pipefs: always return asked length unless all following
00942          * downcalls might be messed up. */
00943         rc = mlen;
00944         RETURN(rc);
00945 }
00946 
00947 static
00948 void gss_pipe_destroy_msg(struct rpc_pipe_msg *msg)
00949 {
00950         struct gss_upcall_msg          *gmsg;
00951         struct gss_upcall_msg_data     *gumd;
00952         static cfs_time_t               ratelimit = 0;
00953         ENTRY;
00954 
00955         LASSERT(list_empty(&msg->list));
00956 
00957         /* normally errno is >= 0 */
00958         if (msg->errno >= 0) {
00959                 EXIT;
00960                 return;
00961         }
00962 
00963         gmsg = container_of(msg, struct gss_upcall_msg, gum_base);
00964         gumd = &gmsg->gum_data;
00965         LASSERT(atomic_read(&gmsg->gum_refcount) > 0);
00966 
00967         CERROR("failed msg %p (seq %u, uid %u, svc %u, nid "LPX64", obd %.*s): "
00968                "errno %d\n", msg, gumd->gum_seq, gumd->gum_uid, gumd->gum_svc,
00969                gumd->gum_nid, (int) sizeof(gumd->gum_obd),
00970                gumd->gum_obd, msg->errno);
00971 
00972         atomic_inc(&gmsg->gum_refcount);
00973         gss_unhash_msg(gmsg);
00974         if (msg->errno == -ETIMEDOUT || msg->errno == -EPIPE) {
00975                 cfs_time_t now = cfs_time_current_sec();
00976 
00977                 if (cfs_time_after(now, ratelimit)) {
00978                         CWARN("upcall timed out, is lgssd running?\n");
00979                         ratelimit = now + 15;
00980                 }
00981         }
00982         gss_msg_fail_ctx(gmsg);
00983         gss_release_msg(gmsg);
00984         EXIT;
00985 }
00986 
00987 static
00988 void gss_pipe_release(struct inode *inode)
00989 {
00990         struct rpc_inode *rpci = RPC_I(inode);
00991         __u32             idx;
00992         ENTRY;
00993 
00994         idx = (__u32) (long) rpci->private;
00995         LASSERT(idx < MECH_MAX);
00996 
00997         upcall_list_lock(idx);
00998         while (!list_empty(&upcall_lists[idx])) {
00999                 struct gss_upcall_msg      *gmsg;
01000                 struct gss_upcall_msg_data *gumd;
01001 
01002                 gmsg = list_entry(upcall_lists[idx].next,
01003                                   struct gss_upcall_msg, gum_list);
01004                 gumd = &gmsg->gum_data;
01005                 LASSERT(list_empty(&gmsg->gum_base.list));
01006 
01007                 CERROR("failing remaining msg %p:seq %u, uid %u, svc %u, "
01008                        "nid "LPX64", obd %.*s\n", gmsg,
01009                        gumd->gum_seq, gumd->gum_uid, gumd->gum_svc,
01010                        gumd->gum_nid, (int) sizeof(gumd->gum_obd),
01011                        gumd->gum_obd);
01012 
01013                 gmsg->gum_base.errno = -EPIPE;
01014                 atomic_inc(&gmsg->gum_refcount);
01015                 gss_unhash_msg_nolock(gmsg);
01016 
01017                 gss_msg_fail_ctx(gmsg);
01018 
01019                 upcall_list_unlock(idx);
01020                 gss_release_msg(gmsg);
01021                 upcall_list_lock(idx);
01022         }
01023         upcall_list_unlock(idx);
01024         EXIT;
01025 }
01026 
01027 static struct rpc_pipe_ops gss_upcall_ops = {
01028         .upcall         = gss_pipe_upcall,
01029         .downcall       = gss_pipe_downcall,
01030         .destroy_msg    = gss_pipe_destroy_msg,
01031         .release_pipe   = gss_pipe_release,
01032 };
01033 
01034 /****************************************
01035  * upcall helper functions              *
01036  ****************************************/
01037 
01038 static
01039 int gss_ctx_refresh_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
01040 {
01041         struct obd_import          *imp;
01042         struct gss_sec             *gsec;
01043         struct gss_upcall_msg      *gmsg;
01044         int                         rc = 0;
01045         ENTRY;
01046 
01047         might_sleep();
01048 
01049         LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec);
01050         LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec->ps_import);
01051         LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec->ps_import->imp_obd);
01052 
01053         imp = ctx->cc_sec->ps_import;
01054         if (!imp->imp_connection) {
01055                 CERROR("import has no connection set\n");
01056                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01057         }
01058 
01059         gsec = container_of(ctx->cc_sec, struct gss_sec, gs_base);
01060 
01061         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(gmsg);
01062         if (!gmsg)
01063                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01064 
01065         /* initialize pipefs base msg */
01066         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&gmsg->gum_base.list);
01067         gmsg->gum_base.data = &gmsg->gum_data;
01068         gmsg->gum_base.len = sizeof(gmsg->gum_data);
01069         gmsg->gum_base.copied = 0;
01070         gmsg->gum_base.errno = 0;
01071 
01072         /* init upcall msg */
01073         atomic_set(&gmsg->gum_refcount, 1);
01074         gmsg->gum_mechidx = mech_name2idx(gsec->gs_mech->gm_name);
01075         gmsg->gum_gsec = gsec;
01076         gmsg->gum_gctx = container_of(sptlrpc_cli_ctx_get(ctx),
01077                                       struct gss_cli_ctx, gc_base);
01078         gmsg->gum_data.gum_seq = upcall_get_sequence();
01079         gmsg->gum_data.gum_uid = ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid;
01080         gmsg->gum_data.gum_gid = 0; /* not used for now */
01081         gmsg->gum_data.gum_svc = import_to_gss_svc(imp);
01082         gmsg->gum_data.gum_nid = imp->imp_connection->c_peer.nid;
01083         strlcpy(gmsg->gum_data.gum_obd, imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
01084                 sizeof(gmsg->gum_data.gum_obd));
01085 
01086         /* This only could happen when sysadmin set it dead/expired
01087          * using lctl by force. */
01088         if (ctx->cc_flags & PTLRPC_CTX_STATUS_MASK) {
01089                 CWARN("ctx %p(%u->%s) was set flags %lx unexpectedly\n",
01090                       ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec),
01091                       ctx->cc_flags);
01092 
01093                 LASSERT(!(ctx->cc_flags & PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE));
01094                 ctx->cc_flags |= PTLRPC_CTX_DEAD | PTLRPC_CTX_ERROR;
01095 
01096                 rc = -EIO;
01097                 goto err_free;
01098         }
01099 
01100         upcall_msg_enlist(gmsg);
01101 
01102         rc = rpc_queue_upcall(de_pipes[gmsg->gum_mechidx]->d_inode,
01103                               &gmsg->gum_base);
01104         if (rc) {
01105                 CERROR("rpc_queue_upcall failed: %d\n", rc);
01106 
01107                 upcall_msg_delist(gmsg);
01108                 goto err_free;
01109         }
01110 
01111         RETURN(0);
01112 err_free:
01113         OBD_FREE_PTR(gmsg);
01114         RETURN(rc);
01115 }
01116 
01117 static
01118 int gss_cli_ctx_refresh_pf(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
01119 {
01120         /* if we are refreshing for root, also update the reverse
01121          * handle index, do not confuse reverse contexts. */
01122         if (ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid == 0) {
01123                 struct gss_sec *gsec;
01124 
01125                 gsec = container_of(ctx->cc_sec, struct gss_sec, gs_base);
01126                 gsec->gs_rvs_hdl = gss_get_next_ctx_index();
01127         }
01128 
01129         return gss_ctx_refresh_pf(ctx);
01130 }
01131 
01132 /****************************************
01133  * lustre gss pipefs policy             *
01134  ****************************************/
01135 
01136 static struct ptlrpc_ctx_ops gss_pipefs_ctxops = {
01137         .match                  = gss_cli_ctx_match,
01138         .refresh                = gss_cli_ctx_refresh_pf,
01139         .validate               = gss_cli_ctx_validate_pf,
01140         .die                    = gss_cli_ctx_die_pf,
01141         .sign                   = gss_cli_ctx_sign,
01142         .verify                 = gss_cli_ctx_verify,
01143         .seal                   = gss_cli_ctx_seal,
01144         .unseal                 = gss_cli_ctx_unseal,
01145         .wrap_bulk              = gss_cli_ctx_wrap_bulk,
01146         .unwrap_bulk            = gss_cli_ctx_unwrap_bulk,
01147 };
01148 
01149 static struct ptlrpc_sec_cops gss_sec_pipefs_cops = {
01150         .create_sec             = gss_sec_create_pf,
01151         .destroy_sec            = gss_sec_destroy_pf,
01152         .kill_sec               = gss_sec_kill,
01153         .lookup_ctx             = gss_sec_lookup_ctx_pf,
01154         .release_ctx            = gss_sec_release_ctx_pf,
01155         .flush_ctx_cache        = gss_sec_flush_ctx_cache_pf,
01156         .install_rctx           = gss_sec_install_rctx,
01157         .alloc_reqbuf           = gss_alloc_reqbuf,
01158         .free_reqbuf            = gss_free_reqbuf,
01159         .alloc_repbuf           = gss_alloc_repbuf,
01160         .free_repbuf            = gss_free_repbuf,
01161         .enlarge_reqbuf         = gss_enlarge_reqbuf,
01162 };
01163 
01164 static struct ptlrpc_sec_sops gss_sec_pipefs_sops = {
01165         .accept                 = gss_svc_accept_pf,
01166         .invalidate_ctx         = gss_svc_invalidate_ctx,
01167         .alloc_rs               = gss_svc_alloc_rs,
01168         .authorize              = gss_svc_authorize,
01169         .free_rs                = gss_svc_free_rs,
01170         .free_ctx               = gss_svc_free_ctx,
01171         .unwrap_bulk            = gss_svc_unwrap_bulk,
01172         .wrap_bulk              = gss_svc_wrap_bulk,
01173         .install_rctx           = gss_svc_install_rctx_pf,
01174 };
01175 
01176 static struct ptlrpc_sec_policy gss_policy_pipefs = {
01177         .sp_owner               = THIS_MODULE,
01178         .sp_name                = "gss.pipefs",
01179         .sp_policy              = SPTLRPC_POLICY_GSS_PIPEFS,
01180         .sp_cops                = &gss_sec_pipefs_cops,
01181         .sp_sops                = &gss_sec_pipefs_sops,
01182 };
01183 
01184 static
01185 int __init gss_init_pipefs_upcall(void)
01186 {
01187         struct dentry   *de;
01188 
01189         /* pipe dir */
01190         de = rpc_mkdir(LUSTRE_PIPE_ROOT, NULL);
01191         if (IS_ERR(de) && PTR_ERR(de) != -EEXIST) {
01192                 CERROR("Failed to create gss pipe dir: %ld\n", PTR_ERR(de));
01193                 return PTR_ERR(de);
01194         }
01195 
01196         /* FIXME hack pipefs: dput will sometimes cause oops during module
01197          * unload and lgssd close the pipe fds. */
01198 
01199         /* krb5 mechanism */
01200         de = rpc_mkpipe(LUSTRE_PIPE_KRB5, (void *) MECH_KRB5, &gss_upcall_ops,
01201                         RPC_PIPE_WAIT_FOR_OPEN);
01202         if (!de || IS_ERR(de)) {
01203                 CERROR("failed to make rpc_pipe %s: %ld\n",
01204                        LUSTRE_PIPE_KRB5, PTR_ERR(de));
01205                 rpc_rmdir(LUSTRE_PIPE_ROOT);
01206                 return PTR_ERR(de);
01207         }
01208 
01209         de_pipes[MECH_KRB5] = de;
01210         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&upcall_lists[MECH_KRB5]);
01211         spin_lock_init(&upcall_locks[MECH_KRB5]);
01212 
01213         return 0;
01214 }
01215 
01216 static
01217 void __exit gss_exit_pipefs_upcall(void)
01218 {
01219         __u32 i;
01220 
01221         for (i = 0; i < MECH_MAX; i++) {
01222                 LASSERT(list_empty(&upcall_lists[i]));
01223 
01224                 /* dput pipe dentry here might cause lgssd oops. */
01225                 de_pipes[i] = NULL;
01226         }
01227 
01228         rpc_unlink(LUSTRE_PIPE_KRB5);
01229         rpc_rmdir(LUSTRE_PIPE_ROOT);
01230 }
01231 
01232 int __init gss_init_pipefs(void)
01233 {
01234         int rc;
01235 
01236         rc = gss_init_pipefs_upcall();
01237         if (rc)
01238                 return rc;
01239 
01240         rc = sptlrpc_register_policy(&gss_policy_pipefs);
01241         if (rc) {
01242                 gss_exit_pipefs_upcall();
01243                 return rc;
01244         }
01245 
01246         return 0;
01247 }
01248 
01249 void __exit gss_exit_pipefs(void)
01250 {
01251         gss_exit_pipefs_upcall();
01252         sptlrpc_unregister_policy(&gss_policy_pipefs);
01253 }
